content.description: Center of wall between Good, Bad, Ugly 5.10c on the left and High Noon 5.11c on the right.
content.protection: Bolts to bolt anchor, small cams optional.
content.location: Center of wall between Good, Bad, Ugly 5.10c on the left and High Noon 5.11c on the right

content.description: This steep sandstone arête could be a classic ! Except for the very old, drilled, baby-angle, pitons. Replaced by glue-in bolts/chemstuds then...Otherwise High Noon is too old to be good. The pitons cost way more than replacement bolts, now, so sell or keep the pins!
content.protection: 6- drilled, 3/8 inch, angled pitons, to bolt anchor with wide vector, so slings.
content.location: Lower Sawmill Canyon, Tensleep Sandstone walls.

content.description: A wild, overhanging, old school, historic crack, that fades to face. Reasonable jamming in twin cracks tapers, dissapears past face climbing with an old bolt. Sorry a early 80’s star drive, 4” long and drilled down protects the crux overhanging face.  A remote route that does not get climbed.
content.protection: 2 sets cams to fist and draws and a long rope to get straight down.
content.location: 1.5 miles up Sawmill Canyon from the confluence with the Popo Agie, on the west side of the canyon is a natural arch, 70m left of the arch in a south facing recess is the Drifter. A big adventure close to the road.

content.description: Start with overhanging Limestone Band, maybe 5.10, then without a full rest, crux up tight, thin corner, to better fingers and lie backs. Trad!
